M. Marvin Berger, J.

opinions.snippet:
Justice Scalia,
dissenting.
The citizens of Chicago were once free to drive about the city at whatever speed they wished. At some point Chica-goans (or perhaps Illinoisans) decided this would not do, and imposed prophylactic speed limits designed to assure safe operation by the average (or perhaps even subaverage) driver with the average (or perhaps even subaverage) vehicle. This infringed upon the “freedom” of
